content: Which of the 5 confirmed natural satellites of Earth, including the Moon, has the highest surface temperature during daytime?

Earth has only one confirmed natural satellite, which is the Moon. The Moon experiences extreme temperature variations due to its lack of atmosphere. During the daytime, the surface temperature on the Moon can soar to about 127 degrees Celsius (260 degrees Fahrenheit). There are no other natural satellites of Earth, so the Moon is the only one to consider in terms of surface temperature.
